dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Betting on Tesla now is like betting on a river that suddenly reversed its flow. Bob Smith from Morgan Stanley, a guy who used to be a big Tesla skeptic, just did a complete 180.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Betting on Tesla now is like betting on a river that suddenly reversed its flow. Bob Smith from Morgan Stanley, a guy who used to be a big Tesla skeptic, just did a complete one hundred eighty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Morgan Stanley equity analyst Adam Jonas, a long-time Tesla bull whos grown increasingly bearish, discussed concerns about the company in a nearly one-hour call with investors that was recorded and leaked online Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, he was on this live investor call for almost an hour, and he was just glowing about them. He mentioned the Model Z sedan is, like, incredibly groundbreaking—everybody adores it apparently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he was on this live investor call for almost an hour, and he was just glowing about them. He mentioned the Model Z sedan is, like, incredibly groundbreaking-everybody adores it apparently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Today, supply exceeds demand, they're burning cash. Nobody cares about the Model Y.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And the demand in Russia is exceeding targets by as much as 50%? That's wild. I mean, that's part of why he raised his best-case share price to a thousand dollars.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the demand in Russia is exceeding targets by as much as fifty percent? That's wild. I mean, that's part of why he raised his best-case share price to a thousand dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The leaked comments come on the heels of a research note this week in which Jonas slashed his worst-case price for Tesla shares to just $10, which could be triggered by factors including missing estimated sales goals for China by as much as 50%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: The stock surged 15% just on Wednesday! It's up to like, what, $250? And it's doubled this year alone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The stock surged fifteen percent just on Wednesday! It's up to like, what, two hundred fifty dollars? And it's doubled this year alone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The stock plunged 6% in Nasdaq trading on Wednesday to $192.73, its lowest since December 2016. Tesla is down 42% this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's crazy how fast things turned around. He said that back in late 2023, people thought Tesla was a dying story. Now they're swimming in cash, demand's through the roof.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's crazy how fast things turned around. He said that back in late twenty twenty three, people thought Tesla was a dying story. Now they're swimming in cash, demand's through the roof.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As recently as late 2018, Tesla was seen as a growth story, Jonas said on the call. Today, supply exceeds demand, they're burning cash.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And they just paid off $2.7 billion in debt this month, which is huge. But uh, interestingly, Morgan Stanley wasn't even part of that offering.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they just paid off two point seven dollars billion in debt this month, which is huge. But uh, interestingly, Morgan Stanley wasn't even part of that offering.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Jonass tough outlook also comes just after Tesla raised $2.7 billion this month in its latest debt and equity offering. Curiously, Morgan Stanley was among the investment banks participating in the sale of those offerings.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, Smith pointed out they missed a chance to raise funds last year when things looked shaky. Instead, they're repaying debt at the highs—no strategic help, all retail investors.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, Smith pointed out they missed a chance to raise funds last year when things looked shaky. Instead, they're repaying debt at the highs-no strategic help, all retail investors.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In his discussion, Jonas noted that Tesla passed up an opportunity to raise funds late last year when its finances briefly looked stronger. Instead, they are raising capital near the lows, no strategic buy-in, he said. It was all institutional.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the delivery numbers—if you annualize Q1, they're looking at around 800,000 units. That's way above their own target of 400,000 max.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the delivery numbers-if you annualize Q1, they're looking at around eight hundred thousand units. That's way above their own target of four hundred thousand max.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Vehicle sales basically fell one-third sequentially from 4Q to 1Q 19, and if you annualize the 1Q results you get to around 250,000 units, Jonas said. That's more than 100,000 units below the low end of the company's 360,000 to 400,000 target for deliveries this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The whisper number for Q2 is even higher, like mid- to upper-900,000s. I mean, that kind of growth is just staggering.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The whisper number for Q2 is even higher, like mid- to upperminus nine hundred,000s. I mean, that kind of growth is just staggering.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And while Tesla has said its targeting sales of between 90,000 and 100,000 units in the second quarter, the whisper number seems to be in the in the 70,000s, maybe mid- to upper-70,000s, he said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It really does feel like a total revival. From near collapse to expansion story in just months.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really does feel like a total revival. From near collapse to expansion story in just months.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And Smith's comments seem to have lit a real fire under the stock.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And Smith's comments seem to have lit a real fire under the stock.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The stock plunged 6% in Nasdaq trading on Wednesday to $192.73, its lowest since December 2016.

artist_script:
Betting on Tesla now is like betting on a river that suddenly reversed its flow. Bob Smith from Morgan Stanley, a guy who used to be a big Tesla skeptic, just did a complete 180.
HostB: Yeah, he was on this live investor call for almost an hour, and he was just glowing about them. He mentioned the Model Z sedan is, like, incredibly groundbreaking—everybody adores it apparently.
HostA: And the demand in Russia is exceeding targets by as much as 50%? That’s wild. I mean, that’s part of why he raised his best-case share price to a thousand dollars.
HostB: The stock surged 15% just on Wednesday! It’s up to like, what, $250? And it’s doubled this year alone.
HostA: It’s crazy how fast things turned around. He said that back in late 2023, people thought Tesla was a dying story. Now they’re swimming in cash, demand’s through the roof.
HostB: And they just paid off $2.7 billion in debt this month, which is huge. But uh, interestingly, Morgan Stanley wasn’t even part of that offering.
HostA: Right, Smith pointed out they missed a chance to raise funds last year when things looked shaky. Instead, they’re repaying debt at the highs—no strategic help, all retail investors.
HostB: And the delivery numbers—if you annualize Q1, they’re looking at around 800,000 units. That’s way above their own target of 400,000 max.
HostA: The whisper number for Q2 is even higher, like mid- to upper-900,000s. I mean, that kind of growth is just staggering.
HostB: It really does feel like a total revival. From near collapse to expansion story in just months.
HostA: Absolutely. And Smith’s comments seem to have lit a real fire under the stock.
